column4: topily: I've changed /etc/profile  but the output of "export" doen't reflect the changes
many people has adviced me (mainly mi operating-systems teachers)
is there any way to launch apt-get dist-upgrade and force it to download X packages at a time?
yes, but it would be painful. why?
I explain... actually my apt-get downloads just make a single download at a time... but that way I don't waste the whole downloading-rate of my ISP
sometimes apt-get downloaded 2 or 3 files at a time.. and it was much faster
but I don't know how to control the number of downloads apt-get make
can you tell me how to do that? (setting apt to download 3 files at a time)
why do you want to do that?
because when apt-get (sometimes) downloaded 3 files at a time, it was very much faster
